headline: AMD Q2 results: Sales beat, earnings miss, strong outlook
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) reported mixed second quarter results and provided a stronger-than-expected revenue outlook. Revenue was $7.69 billion, stronger than the $7.43 billion expected, while adjusted earnings per share (EPS) sat at $0.48, compared to estimates of $0.49. The chipmaker expects third quarter sales to be in the range of $8.4 billion and $9 billion, stronger than Wall Street expected. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime

headline: Chipmaker AMD forecasts third-quarter revenue above estimates
summary: Demand remains robust for AMD's advanced processors that power complex AI systems for Microsoft, Meta Platforms, generative AI leader OpenAI and other customers, with the company set to benefit from cloud giants bumping up their hefty spending plans for building AI infrastructure.  Similarly, Microsoft forecast a record $30 billion in capital spending for the first quarter of the current fiscal year to meet soaring AI demand.  The outlook does not include any revenue from AMD's AI chip MI308's shipments to China as license applications are currently under review by the U.S. Government, the company said.

raw.headline: Chipmaker AMD forecasts third-quarter revenue above estimates
raw.summary: Demand remains robust for AMD's advanced processors that power complex AI systems for Microsoft, Meta Platforms, generative AI leader OpenAI and other customers, with the company set to benefit from cloud giants bumping up their hefty spending plans for building AI infrastructure.  Similarly, Microsoft forecast a record $30 billion in capital spending for the first quarter of the current fiscal year to meet soaring AI demand.  The outlook does not include any revenue from AMD's AI chip MI308's shipments to China as license applications are currently under review by the U.S. Government, the company said.

headline: AMD Reports Second Quarter 2025 Financial Results
summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., Aug. 05, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) today announced financial results for the second quarter of 2025. Second quarter revenue was a record $7.7 billion, gross margin was 40%, operating loss was $134 million, net income was $872 million and diluted earnings per share was $0.54. On a non-GAAP(*) basis, gross margin was 43%, operating income was $897 million, net income was $781 million and diluted earnings per share was $0.48. As previously announced, our second

headline: Nvidia Stock Is Falling. Cathie Wood Bought More Stock.
summary: Nvidia  stock was inching down Tuesday, a day after  Cathie Wood’s  ARK Invest disclosed increased stakes in the chip maker.  On Monday, Wood’s funds bought 23,211  Nvidia  shares—worth around $4.2 million at the close—across two exchange-traded funds, the  and the the  according to ARK’s daily trade file.  Nvidia represents 2.7% of both funds, as the 13th and 14th largest holding, respectively.

headline: Nvidia Slips As AMD, Super Micro Earnings Loom; Is Nvidia A Buy Or Sell Now?
summary: Nvidia slipped on Tuesday as investors awaited earnings from its artificial intelligence chip rival Advanced Micro Devices.  Another key earnings report from Super Micro Computer is also awaited at market close.  Investors will look for Advanced Micro Devices to post a decline in second-quarter adjusted earnings to 48 cents a share but a 27% revenue increase to $7.4 billion, according to MarketSurge data.

headline: AMD Aims To Dethrone Nvidia In AI Race—Here's How
summary: Nvidia Corp's (NASDAQ:NVDA) AI chip empire is built on H100s, which cost up to $40,000. It is the go-to for tech titans like Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ:MSFT) and Meta Platforms Inc (NASDAQ:META). But with supply shortages and U.S. export bans choking sales to China, startups and sovereign AI dreamers in India and the UAE are increasingly turning to Advanced Micro Devices Inc (NASDAQ:AMD). AMD’s secret sauce lies in its cheaper alternative in the MI300 chips, and its open-source ROCm software. Track
